title: HDMI Signal Loss Crash (Re-post cause the other one vanished)
body:
When playing league of legends at random points my game crashes and i lose signal to both of my monitors (both use HDMI) and i'm forced to restart my PC. After restarting it still crashes even without playing league when i'm watching Youtube/Twitch.
However one morning i decided to have an entire day playing another game (Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn) and it didnt crash once. Not even short crashes or FPS drops.

I'm running;
A single AMD 480
8GB of RAM
a fairly old motherboard and processor (not old enough that it cant handle most games made back in 2013)
I have restarted my PC to factory settings about 2 months ago
I'm using the newest drivers for AMD
My motherboard bios aren't up to date as i have no idea what model i'm running (Planning on getting a new one)
I run the game at medium settings in windowed mode (however i have tried both windowed and full-screen)
This mostly started around patch 7.11-7.13 however i had the issue once or twice over the 3 years I've been playing only recently has it become every 2/3 games.

hello again, i posted this on your other post, but just wanted to make sure you saw it:

hey man,

That sounds like what happened to me a few PC builds ago. In my case my GPU was getting too hot and my PC was shutting down/restarting to protect itself. in your case it looks like you're running on board graphics, potentially from your CPU. What i discovered in my case was that the fan on my graphics card stopped working. In your case it could be a few things, assuming I've diagnosed your issue correctly: there could be a big build up of dust on hardware, a fan(s) may have stopped working, you need to re-apply thermal paste that connects your CPU to the heatsink attached to it.

disclaimer: I'm not a professional at this so take everything with a grain of salt. Also, when i opened up my case and touched my GPU to see what was going on i burned my hand pretty bad so please be careful :)
